title: The 2015 Brussels Comic Strip Festival has begun!Travelandtourworld.com
text:
The 2015 Brussels Comic Strip Festival has begun!
On Thursday 3 September the press conference inaugurating the Brussels Comic Strip Festival took place. The Festival will open to the public at 15:30 on Friday. At the press conference the Raymond Leblanc Foundation handed out its prestigious Award to Aude Mermilliod for her project Les Reflets Changeants (Changing Reflections). The Raymond Leblanc Award is the largest in Europe for youth talent in the 9th art.
The marquees have been prepared, the exhibitions have been set up, and everyone at the Comic Strip Festival is eagerly awaiting visitors. Tomorrow, on Friday at 15:30, a fast-paced sequence of comic-related events begins which will take place throughout Brussels until Sunday 6 September. Bigger than ever, the Brussels Comic Strip Festival will take on multiple facets. Here is a non-exhaustive summary:
• The Comic Strip Festival: In a space twice as big as that of previous years, the Comic Strip Festival offers a varied programme of activities: different publishing houses will come to present their comics and their cartoonists, there will be a special focus on manga and comics, and visitors will be able to discover foreign comics at an international pavilion.
• The “extras” of the Comic Strip Festival: This year, the whole of Brussels will celebrate the Comic Strip Festival in unison: there will be free guided tours, special showings at the Cinematek, comic month at City 2… A mini train will also take visitors to selected comic-related locations, with special rates during the Brussels Comic Strip Festival.
• Comic strip nights: On Friday and Saturday evening from 21:00 to 23:30, Brussels Park will be host to screenings, illustrated concerts and live-drawing.
• The Balloon’s Day Parade : The “Balloon’s Day Parade” will, for the 7th year running, be heading down Brussels’s main streets from 14:00 on Sunday 6 September. Composed of famous Belgian comic strip characters, the Balloon’s Day Parade will give kids young and old the opportunity to see these gigantic balloons.
• The journal Tintin Rally: On Sunday, around 80 cars and motorbikes depicted in the journal Tintin between 1946 and 1988 will come to life at the Comic Strip Festival. The Rally, which starts at Louvain-la-Neuve, will finish at the Place des Palais from 14:30.
Source:- Visit Brussels
